Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery skyphos of Corinthian type; interior: narrow reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: black line below rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of komos scene; upper part of male figure, wearing a fillet with his hair tied back and a short added red chiton, to right; at left, probably parts of the hands of another figure.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0610.2. For parallels, see Athens, NM inv. 640 in ABV, 26, no. 21: Komast Group: I, the KX Painter; Simon, E., Die Griechischen Vasen. Munich 1981, pl. 49, below; Add2, 7. It is not certain that the sherd British Museum 1888,0601.594.d is the one described in BM Cat.Vases II (B 103.29).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.29)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 228, no. 24 (a))
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 258, no. 17 pl. XV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0328) (Phase 1)
